scene.name: intro
scene.line: Oh. I didn't know those were still down here.

scene.name: what-was-that
scene.line: Look, there's a tape player down there, one of those old reel-to-reel setups.

scene.name: down-here-before
scene.line: Not this deep. But I knew about the tape machines.

scene.name: archivists-first-time
scene.line: When this mine was active, a couple of folk music archivists spent time here recording miners' songs. Really academic, ivory tower types. None of the miners really talked to them much.
So they stayed at the margins, observed, took notes, and then sometimes they'd get someone on a lunch break to sing into their microphone.
Then I guess the power company got some kind of interest in the project, and gave the archivists some coal scrip tokens to pay the miners with for their songs.

scene.name: archivists-again
scene.line: They'd record up on that old scaffolding we saw, and I guess then they'd sequester themselves down here to listen to the recorded songs.

scene.name: parents-sing
scene.line: Oh, uh ... yeah. They sang. They sang in the mine for coal scrip tokens.

scene.name: happened-to-archivists
scene.line: They got out. When the flood came, they left.
